info.title: ServicePOS API
info.description: The Open API specification for ServicePOS. Further docs at https://app.deltateq.com/doc/api

post.summary: User login from existing user to different user belonging to the same store

parameters.description: Return the count or not. More slow, consider using thasMore for pagination

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter expression. See https://restdocs.e-conomic.com/#filtering. `In` and `Not In` are **not** supported.

parameters.name: paginationStart
parameters.description: Determine the offset (in number of products) to fetch. This is usually a multiple of the pageLength.

parameters.name: paginationPageLength
parameters.description: Determine the number of products to fetch in one page.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sorting order. If `order` is 1, products are retrieved in ascending order, if -1, in descending order.

post.description: Subscribe to an event like product.created with a callback url to get pinged when the event triggers. See http://resthooks.org/

schema.description: The hook information expected when subscribing to an event.

event.description: The event name of the subscription using noun.verb syntax.

url.description: The callback url of the subscription.

active.description: Whether or not the hook is enabled.

schema.description: The hook information returned when subscribing to an an event.

unsubscribeOp.description: The `id` returned in the response is used as the parameter `hookId` in `DELETE /hooks/{hookId}`

get.description: Get the subscription details for given an id.

put.description: Update the subscription for an event given an id.

schema.description: The hook information expected when subscribing to an event.

event.description: The event name of the subscription using noun.verb syntax.

url.description: The callback url of the subscription.

active.description: Whether or not the hook is enabled.

schema.description: The status of the subscription update.

updated.description: Whether or not the event was updated. 0 for failure, 1 for success.

delete.description: Unsubscribe from an event given an id for subscription.

schema.description: The status of the subscription deletion.

deleted.description: Whether or not the event was deleted. 0 for failure, 1 for success.

post.summary: Given a ticket, apply promotions to materials based on materials and customer and return the list of materials.
Given a cart, return the new cart with promotion discounts applied.
post.description:
This endpoint is primarily used in our own POS implementation assumes our own cart data structure.

The bare minimum data structure for this call is an object with a property `articles` which is a list of `CartArticle`.
Each article contains extra information about whether it is a product, discount etc. and whether it was created manually or automatically.

In the future, this might be made more generally applicable.

post.summary: Get all relevant promotions for a set of products and a customer.
post.description:
Get all relevant promotions for a set of products and a customer.
Currently the customer is ignore and can be null.
This query can be seen as "given a cart, what promotions will match?"

If you have multiple of the same products in the query, they should be represented as a `CartArticle`,
i.e. specified by a `productno` and `quantity` (see example). Otherwise, you can simply use productno strings.

parameters.name: paginationStart
parameters.description: Determine the offset (in number of items) to fetch. This is usually a multiple of the pageLength.

parameters.name: paginationPageLength
parameters.description: Determine the number of item to fetch in one page.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
Optional. If equal to `1`, only active promotions will be returned,
i.e. only promotions with `active` attribute set to `true` and where today's date is inside the date range of the promotion.
By default, all promotions including inactive will be listed.

parameters.name: freeText
parameters.description: Optional. Search for promotion name, product, brand, tag and customer group

parameters.name: actionType
parameters.description: Optional. Search promotions by its action type

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Optional. Search promotions by start date (format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Optional. Search promotions by end date (format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS)

post.description:
Create a new promotion that results in an automatic discount when matching products are put in the POS cart.

The automatic assignment of discounts is based product filters (explained in more detail below).
When these filters match, the promotion triggers an action resulting in some kind of discount presentend in the cart.
Currently, actions come in two flavors: *single product discounts* and *bundle discounts*.
How the promotion will trigger depends on this flavor.

Single product discounts (`percentage`, `adjustPriceBy`, `percentageByCostprice`, `totalPriceUnit`):
  Here, a single product gets discount by some amount.
  The filters can match against productnos, brands and tags.

Bundle discounts (`totalPrice`):
  Here, multiple products combine to give a single discount,
  for instance "Buy X and Y and get it for the price of X."
  Currently, these types of promotions only support matching against a list of productnos.

Each promotion has a required `name` which shown in the cart when the discount is given.
`description` is optional and designed only for humans to read. It is only shown in the settings.
`active` can be used to disable promotions until they are ready.
Promotions will also only be considered active when today's date is inside the `startdate`-`enddate`-range.
If `enddate` is `null`, the promotion is considered to run forever.

Product filters are inclusive by nature. In the future, excluding filters will be added as well.
Filters have an `attribute` and a `value`. The attribute can be various attributes of a product, like `tag` and `productno`.
For instance, to give a discount on all bikes with tag *Bike*, see the example below).
The `value` can be a list of values in which case, if either of the values match, the filter matches.
And if either of the filters matches, the promotion will trigger (in case of single product discounts).

The filters for bundle discounts currently needs to be very specific:
A single filter with `attribute` = productno and `value` = *list of productnos*.

In the future, it will be possible to filter based on customer attributes as well, such that specific customers can get certain discounts.

get.description: Given a specific promotion id, fetch the entire promotion object.

put.description: Replace the promotion object of a specific promotion with another.

updated.description: Whether or not the promotion was deleted. 0 for failure, 1 for success.

delete.description: Delete a promotion based an id.

deleted.description: Whether or not the promotion was deleted. 0 for failure, 1 for success.

apitoken.description: The apitoken returned on a successful auth request

userid.description: The userid of the user logged in to (if relevant)

passcode.description: The passcode of the user to log in to

targetStoreId.description: The id of the store to log in to

apitoken.description: The apitoken of the user who is making the authentication request

email.description: The email of the TaskUser to log in to

password.description: The password of the TaskUser to log in to

economic_agreement_grant_token.description: E-conomic agreement grant token used by E-conomic app store redirect

state.description: The connection state of the BamdeskDevice.

derivedstate.description: The derived connection state of the BamdeskDevice.

lastactivity.description: The timestamp of the time the device was last used

dateadded.description: The date the customertarticle was created

customerid.description: The ID of the customer the customerarticle belongs to

CustomerArticleListResponse.description: Response when requesting a list of customer articles

CustomerArticleResponse.description: Response when requesting a customer article

SetCustomerArticle.description: The body of the request used for creating / updating CustomerArticles

CustomerTagsResponse.description: The customer tags used by a store.

count.description: The total number of customer tags found

phone.description: The phone number of the customer. Should start with country code, like +45. If not, assume +45.

zipcode.description: The zip code of the customer.

country.description: The country of the customer. Must be in format ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with the customer. Must be a valid EAN.

vat.description: The VAT/CVR number associated with the customer.

economic_customernumber.description: The e-conomic number of the customer.

draft.description: Whether or not the customer is in draft mode

CustomerResponse.description: The representation of a customer response

SetCustomer.description: The body of the request used for creating / updating customers

SearchCustomerResponse.description: The representation of a customer search.

count.description: The total number of customers found by the query if ignoring pagination. Is null if `count` was not specified in the query parameter.

hasMore.description: True if there are more customers to receive than the current pagination allowed.

errorcode.description: A string representation of the error that can easily be identified.

logid.description: A reference to the log entry if the error was logged.

storeid.description: A reference to the customer. NULL if no customer is authenticated

metadata.description: An object with extra error information

debug.descripton: An object with debugging information. Only visible in development mode

giftcardno.description: a unique string to identify giftcards.

paymentmaterialid.description: a reference to the payment material

paymentid.description: a reference to the payment material

store.description: The store from which the giftcard has been issued. Can be different from the current store if giftcards are shared between stores.

customer.description: The customer who brought the giftcard

createddate.description: When the gift card was issued.

expirationdate.description: When the gift card expires. Defaults to the createddate + the value of the storeconfig "giftcard_expiration_years".

SearchGiftcardsResponse.description: The representation of a gift card search.

count.description: The total number of items found by the query.

PostGiftcardsRequest.description: The giftcard to be created by the post.

PostGiftcardsResponse.description: The respone of a gift card creation.

count.description: The total number of items found by the query if ignoring pagination.

RestHook.description: Object representing a rest hook subscription.

id.description: A unique ID. Use this to handle this subscription.

receiver.description: An identifier to distinguish different receivers.

active.description: Whether or not the hook is enabled.

lastactivity.description: Date of last time the hook got used.

RestHookEventResponse.description: The list of events that can be subscribed to, like `product.created`.

title.description: The name of a payment type

accountno.description: The account number associated with the payment type

currency.description: The currency associated with the payment type

exchangerate.description: The exchange rate of the given currency (if any) to the store's main currency.

cash.description: Whether or not the payment type is physical cash

POSBalance.description: The representation of a POS balance

date.description: The date of the balance. Defaults to current date

numpayments.description: The number of payments in the balance.

cashstart.description: The cash in the register at the start of the balance.

cashcounted.description: The counted cash in the cash register

cashtobank.description: Cash taken out of the register and put in the bank.

cashregistertitle.description: The name of the cash register (if any)

lastdinerosync.description: The datetime of the last Dinero sync (if any)

lasteconomicsync.description: The datetime of the last E-conomic sync (if any)

paymenttypeid.description: The id of the payment type (if present)

amount.description: The amount of the payment type.

cash.description: Returns whether or not the payment type is cash-based.

bamdesk_messageid.description: The id for the Bambora card-terminal if it is used. Null otherwise.

accountno.description: The account where the payment has been posted. If not applicable, it will be null.

giftcardtype.description: The giftcard type if a giftcard is used. Null otherwise.

giftcardissued.description: The total amount issued on giftcards.

giftcardused.description: The total amount spent via giftcards.

returnsum.description: The total sum of returned articles

economicinvoicesum.description: "The sum of payments paid with  economic invoices."

stockvalue.description: Stock value of the store's inventory at the time of the POS balance

SearchPOSBalanceResponse.description: The representation of a pos balance search.

count.description: The total number of items found by the query.

amount.description: The amount of the payment type.

cash.description: Returns whether or not the payment type is cash-based.

bamdesk_messageid.description: The id for the messageid for Bambora card-terminal if it is used. Null otherwise.

accountno.description: The account where the payment has been posted. If not applicable, it will be null.

PaymentArticle.description: The repsentation of a POS article If you want to issue gift card, sell a product with productno either 'giftcard', 'voucher', or 'deposit'. Quantity must be 1 If you want to return a giftcard set giftcardid and quantity to -1.  Price must be positive If you want to use a giftcard set giftcardid and quantity to 1. Price must be be negative any other value for quantiy and price for giftcards will fail.

costprice.description: cost price at the time of payment

giftcardno.description: Giftcardno used as means of payment

usedGiftcardId.description: id of used as mean of payment

productno.description: For legacy support, instead refer to product.productno. This is only used for voucher and deposit

product.description: A reference to the product in the current state

discount_ppm_id.description: If the article has a discount. This will be a reference to the discount article

discountedToken.description: If you want to apply a discount to this article, discountToken on the discount must match disccountedToken

POSPayment.description: The repsentation of a POS sale

userid.description: The id of the user who did the payment

customerid.description: The id of the customer if any was attached to the payment

numberofmaterials.description: the number of materials on the payment

sum.description: The sum of the payment materials

cashRegisterId.description: the id of the cash register used for the payment

cashRegisterTitle.description: the title of posregister. Only here for legacy reasons

invoice.description: 1 if payment is a invoice payment e.g. via economic

customer.description: The customer refered to by customerid

taskids.description: If the payment is a payment of more tasks. Using this will mark the tasks as paid

cash.description: 1 if you payed with cash, 0 if you didn't

storeid.description: Included when partner store payments are included

SearchPOSPaymentResponse.description: The representation of a pos payment search.

count.description: The total number of items found by the query.

paymenttypes.description: A list of payment types associated with this POS register

bamdeskdevices.description: A list of bamdesk devices associated with this POS register

SetPOSRegister.description: The body of the request used to create/update a POS register.

ProductMasterData.description: The representation of a product master data (stamdata).

industry.description: Industry. Examples: bikeshop, garden, phone, jewelry, generic.

lastupdate.description: Date time of the last time this entry was updated

ProductMasterDataResponse.description: The representation of product master data (response).

SetProduct.description: The body of the request used to create/update products.

resthookmetadata.description: The string content has to be valid JSON. It can contain whatever meta data  a resthook could use. For example, 'syncproductdatawebshop' could be set to true, so the  function, that receives the resthook, knows whether or not to sync a given product.

stocktransactionreason.description: The reason why the product stock was updated. This will be saved in the product stock transaction log.

stocknochangeisrelative.description: If true, the Product.stockno update is interpreted as relative to its previous value; for example, if the previous value was 40 and you pass Product.stockno=42, it's interpreted as adding 2 (e.g. receiving 2 items from a supplier), and if you pass Product.stockno=38, it's interpreted as removing 2 (e.g. selling 2 items). If stocknochangeisrelative is false, the change is interpreted as absolute, e.g. with the intention of setting the initial value or correcting a wrong number. Note it has no direct effect on how ServicePOS functions; Product.stockno will always be set to the specified value; but it affects REST hooks (product.updated events) and 3rd party integrations if they distinguish between absolute and relative changes in the number of items in stock. See also stocknochangetype in Product.

orderid.description: A reference to the shopping list item id for which this product stock has been updated.

setatpartners.description: Create/update relavant product data at partner stores

hasNextPage.description: If there exists a result page after the current page. Use this to create a 'next page' functionality

Product.description: The representation of a product. Notice the FlexPOS fields are only relevant for customers using FlexPOS

productno.description: The product no. This must be unique. If serieno is set we allow multiple products to have the same product no. For new products this value must be at most 25 chars

price.description: Price of the product incl. VAT

costprice.description: Cost price of the product excl. VAT

stockno.description: Number of items in stock. Set to null to disable stock keeping. If you want update stock, create a stock transaction. For more info see stocktransaction overwrite

previousstockno.description: Previous stockno value. Only set in RestHook events; in product.updated if stockno has changed; and always in product.created with a value of 0

stocknochangetype.description: Type of stockno change. Only set in RestHook events; in product.updated if stockno has changed; and always in product.created with a value of 'absolute'. When relative it indicates adding or removing (e.g. selling) items from inventory. When absolute it indicates taking inventory, e.g. setting an initial value or correcting an errornous value. See also stocknochangeisrelative in SetProduct.

suppliername.description: This field is obsolete and therefore can't add a supplier using this field. If you want to add a supplier use the "suppliers" field instead

suppliers.description: List of suppliers attached to the product. If you leave supplier id empty, any suppliername that does not exits will be created.

vat.description: The VAT of the product in percent. Should in most cases be NULL. NULL will default the VAT value to the one specified in store config (25 % for DK customers)

lastordered.description: The date for when the product was last ordered. Can only be set while create a shoppinglistorder

tags.description: List of product tags.  Hint, if you leave tag id empty, any tag that does not exist will be created.

reservedstock.description: Number of items of this product reserved on open work cards

tobeordered.description: Number of items that needs to be ordered. Based on stockmin, stockmax and whats already on shopping list.

onshoppinglist.description: Number of items already on shopping list.

ordered.description: Number of items currently in order

needsordering.description: True if the product is in low stock and needs to be ordered.  Based on stockmin, stockmax and whats already in order.

flexposuid.description: FlexPOS UID. Should mostly be left untouched

flexposviewgroup.description: FlexPOS view group. Should mostly be left untouched. Must be in sync with flexposviewgroupid

flexposviewgroupid.description: FlexPOS view group id. Should mostly be left untouched

flexposfinancegroup.description: FlexPOS finance group. Should mostly be left untouched. Must be in sync with flexposfinancegroup

flexposfinancegroupid.description: FlexPOS finance group id. Should mostly be left untouched. Must be in sync with flexposfinancegroup

flexposbrandid.description: FlexPOS brand id. Should mostly be left untouched. Must be in sync with brand

discountprice.description: The discounted price of the product

SearchProductResponse.description: The representation of a product search.

count.description: The total number of products found by the query if ignoring pagination. Is null if `count` was not specified in the query parameter.

hasMore.description: True if there are more products to receive than the current pagination allowed.

accountno.description: The accountno used for book keeping

ProductTagListResponse.description: The product tags used by a store.

count.description: The total number of product tags found

SearchPromotionResponse.description: The representation of a promotion search.

count.description: The total number of promotions found by the query if ignoring pagination.

id.description: A unique ID. Use this to handle this subscription.

description.example: 10% on all bikes in the summer.
description.description: Description of the promotion. This is only displayed in the controlpanel, not for the customers.

active.description: Whether or not the promotion is enabled. Disabled promotions do not trigger even when inside the date range.

startdate.description: Specifies when the promotion starts. Null if the promotion has no startdate and thus is always in effect (except if active is 0).

enddate.description: Specifies when the promotion ends. Null if the promotion has no enddate.

minproducts.description: Minimum number of prodcts before the promotion is in effect

articles.description: A list of products from the cart that match the promotion. This will only be set in the case of the lookup endpoint.

count.description: The number of times this promotion matches things in the cart. This will only be set in the case of the lookup endpoint.

PromotionProductFilter.description: Filter promotion based on different product attributes.

attribute.description: What attribute to filter the promotion on.

anyOf.description: The value that the attribute needs to have to match.
A list of possible values. The attribute needs to match at least one of the values for the rule to apply.

PromotionCustomerFilter.description: Filter promotion based on different customer attributes.

attribute.description: What attribute to filter the promotion on.

anyOf.description: A list of possible values. The attribute needs to match at least one of the values for the rule to apply.
The value that the attribute needs to have to match.

PromotionAction.description: The action / effect the promotion has on checkout.

amount.description: The amount to be deducted, depending on the `type`.

PromotionLookup.description: The object used to query for relevant promotions based on products and customers.

allowInactive.description: Whether or not the lookup should find promotions which are inactive

customer.description: The id of the customer. Can be null, if returned promotions should be relevant for all customers.

productno.description: The product number of the product that the article represents.

quantity.description: The amount that is present of that product.

BillingModules.description: for each module, true if the module is active and subscription is active

inTrial.description: If store does not have active subscription and trail is not expired

outOfTasks.description: True if maxTasks has been exceeded

isPaying.description: True if the customer is currently being charged for the plan. E.g. not on trail or any other free payment option.

maxTasks.description: Maximum number of tasks for billings periode

active.description: true if account is active. Will false if payment is missing

deactivationDate.description: ate for when active will be or was set to false

showWarning.description: True if subscription shoud be warning.  For example if invoices have not been paid

showWarningDate.description: Date for when showarning will be or was set to true

ConfigAPI.description: A config. For a complete list refer to https://app.deltateq.com/doc/api/configs.php

SetConfigs.description: The body of the request used to create/update configs.

targetStoreId.description: If supplied, will be used as the target store to set storeconfigs (only if the apitoken has adequate permission).
If supplied, will be used as the target store to set storeconfigs (only if the source apitoken has adequate permission).

derivedDevices.description: Array of each print desk device's settings

ServiceNotification.description: scheduled service call done via sms

days.description: if isAbsolute is false, send notification after days

isAbsolute.description: if true, use day, month, and year to specifiy absolute day for service notification. Days is ignored

noticedate.description: Date when the service call will be send out relative today. Computed from

template.description: SMS template for the service call
template.example: Hej [customer_name] det er tid til frste service af din nye cykel. Kig ind eller ring til os p [store_phone]2

SetShoppingListItem.description: The body of the request used to create/update a shopping list item.

partnerstoreid.description: The store id of the store that item is moved to. Stock movements are recieved as shopping list orders. The store id must be on the store's stock partner list.

ShoppingListItem.description: The representation of a shopping list item. The shopping list is a set of products the store must rememeber to order from a supplier.

supplierid.description: The supplierid attached to the order

amount.description: The number of items to buy

materialid.description: a reference to the task material

taskid.description: a reference to the task of the material

orderlistno.description: The orderlist no of the attached orderlist

orderlistid.description: The order id if the shopping list item has been ordered. Can only be set while creating a shopping list order.

delivereddate.description: when item has delivered to stock. Specificied by setting orderid when updating product.

product.description: The product refered to by productid

received.description: Amount of items that are received

inorder.description: Amount of items that are not received

SearchShoppingListResponse.description: The representation of a shopping list search.

count.description: The total number of items found by the query.

ShoppingListOrder.description: The representation of a shopping list order item. An order is at set of shopping list items that have been ordered

orderlistno.description: The number of orderlistno (unique for storeid)

receiveditems.description: Number of shopping list items which have been received

itemcount.description: Total number of shopping list items on the order

totalamount.description: Total amount of items that needs to be ordered

totalinorder.description: Total amount of items that are still in order

completed.description: 1 if the order is completed, 0 otherwise

delivereddate.description: Date of latest received item if completed

SetShoppingListOrder.description: The body of the request used to create/update a shopping list item.

SearchShoppingListOrderResponse.description: The representation of a shopping list search.

count.description: The total number of items found by the query.

ShoppingListTotalCostPrice.description: Total cost price of an shopping list

SearchStockTransactionResponse.description: The response of a stock transaction search.

count.description: The total number of items found by the query if ignoring pagination.

StockTransaction.description: Apply relative changes to a product. If the change is positive i.e. addtostock > 0 a per item cost price must be specified with costpriceofaddeditems. If addtostock > 0 no cost price must be specified. i.e. costpriceofaddeditems must be NULL. If addtostock = 0 you will get a 400 error. If you want to apply a absolute overwrite to a product stock. Set the value using PUT /product/{id}.

addtostock.description: Number of items to add to the stock for the product. The value can be negative if some items are removed from the stock. If absoluteoverwrite is 1, the addtostock will be the difference between the new and old stockvalue.

costpriceofaddeditems.description: The pr. unit cost price of the added items. Must be NULL if addtostock is negative.

stocktransactionlistid.description: Stock transaction can be grouped into lists. And all applied as a single transaction. See stock transaction list.

stocktransactionlist.description: The list refered to by stocktransactionlistid

stocknoafter.description: The product stock right after the transaction was applied

absoluteoverwrite.description: Indicates the stock transactions is an absolute adjustment of stock value and costprice. Any AVG calculation will start from the latest overwrite. You can do an absolute adjustment by changing costprice or stockno when updating a product using the product endpoint.

commit.description: Set to 1 if you want the stock transaction to be applied. Once commited a transaction cannot be changed. If the value is 0, the stock transaction is saved and can be committed by later setting commit = 1. Note, by default all stock transactions are committed. Use 0 to create draft transactions that will later be commiited.

committeddate.description: Date when the stock transaction was commited. Null if not committed

product.description: The product pointed to be productid. This is included for convenience.

miscdata.description: Use to save any misc data with the transaction. Misc data will be cleared when transaction is commited

pospaymentmaterialid.description: pospaymentmaterial id if transaction was triggered by a sale

orderid.description: set if the stock transaction was created from a shopping list item

costpriceavg.description: the total cost price of the stock transction following average princip

totalstockvalueavg.description: The total stock value of the product at the time of transaction following average princip

userid.description: Id of user who made the stocktransaction

SetStockTransaction.description: The body of the request used to create/update products.

SetStockTransactionList.description: The body of the request used to create/update products.

StockTransactionList.description: A list of stock transactions. Set commit = 1 to commit all transactions in a list.

committeddate.description: If the inventory list is booked

commit.description: PUT with value 1 to commit all stock transactions in the list. If type == "move", a stock move is done, if type == "reception" a stock reception is done

movetostoreid.description: The store id of the partner to move the stock to. Can only be set if type = move

orderlistno.description: The orderlist no of the attached orderlist

inventorycountreportid.description: The  id of report that was created on inventory count

reportno.description: The report number of the attached report

orderlistid.description: The id of the orderlistid which the stocktransaction list was created from

partnersyncdate.description: The date the stock transaction list was synced to an external service (e.g. E-conomic)

userid.description: Id of the user who created/committed the stocktransaction

count.description: Number of available items, if ignoring pagination.

id.description: A unique id for a supplier

city.description: Which city the supplier is from

TicketFileListResponse.description: Response when requesting a list of task files based on some filters.

TicketFileResponse.description: Response when requesting a task file

SetTicketFile.description: The body of the request used when creating / updating task files.

usedGiftcardid.description: If set, the material represents the use of giftcard for paying for the tasks

promotionid.description: The promotion id of the that triggered the discount

deletedPromotionId.description: If a promotion is deleted, remember on the promoted material it has been deleted so we don't apply it again

expecteddeliveries.description: List of dates, when the material is expected to be delivered from ongoing orders

items.description: The date of when the material is expected to be delivered

SetTicketMaterial.description: The body of the request used for creating / updating TicketMaterials

TicketMaterialListResponse.description: Response when requesting a list of task materials based on some filters.

TicketMaterialResponse.description: Response when requesting a list of task materials based on some filters.

Ticket.description: A ticket representing a repair or work task.

items.description: The ID of the article associated with ticket (if any).

assignee.description: The ID of the employee assigned to the ticket.

createByUserId.description: The ID of the employee who created the ticket.

assigneeName.description: The name of the employee assigned to the ticket.

cardno.description: An ID for the ticket that is readable in the webapp.

autoincrementno.description: A unique auto incrementing ID for the ticket

description.description: A description of what will or has been done.

agreedPrice.description: Price agreed with customer incl. VAT

numComments.description: How many comments exist on the ticket.

totalPrice.description: Total price of the all materials incl. VAT

draft.description: Whether or not the ticket is in draft mode

taskserviceid.description: Id of a task service attached to the task

TicketCountResponse.description: Response when requesting a list tickets based on some filters.

TicketListResponse.description: Response when requesting a list tickets based on some filters.

count.description: Number of available tickets, if ignoring pagination.

SetTicket.description: The body of the request used for creating / updating tickets

shopuser.description: User is used for selling stuff

hasPasscode.description: Whether or not the user is protected by a (4 digit) passcode

hasPassword.description: Whether or not the user is protected by a password

deleted.description: 1 if the user is a deleted user, 0 otherwise

mainuser.description: Whether or not the user is the store's main user. This is set on store creation and cannot be changed.
